intro: Phaca alpina, commonly known as the alpine phaca, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes familiar plants like carrots and parsley. This herbaceous perennial typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at high altitudes. Its small, white or yellowish flowers bloom in umbels, and it has finely divided, fern-like leaves. Phaca alpina is often found in alpine meadows and is adapted to cold, harsh environments.
